EMUTMKI6WSXsYZuaOgzd7Q.text: If I had to summarize this place with one word it would definitely be 'overrated'. Visited this café a few days ago, surrounded by at least ten young ladies taking pictures of their rose lattes. One of the filthiest bathrooms I have ever seen, service was slow and not particularly nice, and most importantly, food was meh. What can I say? Instagram can be deceiving. Seriously, there are so many good cafés and restaurants in London. This one just doesn't live up to the hype.

pkTyCvJe7pRkDKfk1TlW-Q.text: The food was not good (£10 for a small bowl of lettuce and cherry tomatoes?). The service was worse. We tried for 15 minutes to flag down our waiter and he avoided eye contact with us. We were seated in the middle of the restaurant closest to him and were completely ignored. Also I literally can't even count on two hands how many Instagrams I was in the background of. This restaurant is basic girl heaven. So if you're into good social media pics and bad food this might be the place for you.

XAACoLIWiT5x1CJrnnoxMg.text: Arrived on a weekday a little before 11:30, and we were the last table to be seated. Afterwards, there was a line. I had the pancakes and liquid gold tea. I wasn't a big fan of the tea, the spices settled on the bottom quickly. There were two large pancakes topped with berries and coconut. Not the best pancakes I've ever had, but satisfying.

nqTnmXrBMY4ti5S57IZqXg.text: it's quite a shame to give this place such low rating as i was really looking forward to going here since they serve organic and vegan food and coffee. I took my sister here on a rainy day out in Notting Hill and wanted to spend a nice lunch with her. we were seated in a nice place for two but then forgotten for around 10-15 minutes. we had a nice waitress taking and placing our order hence one of the stars. the other star goes out to having vegan options for both lattes (almond milk) and food (i took the winter kale salad). Though the rest of the experience wasn't all that pleasant. My latte was not hot in the first place, the almond milk (which they charge an extra 60p for) didn't seem to be fresh either because the espresso and the milk wouldn't combine properly. A shame when you pay 3,5 for a quite small coffee.And now the salad. It cost 8,5 for lots of kale and just half a fig, some pistachios and chunks of quinoa - the combination could be nice of it hadn't been drowned in lemon juice. Made the whole thing not quite enjoyable and i was missing any other kind of flavour. Even salt and pepper didn't help out here - not to mention i felt a bit hungry just two hours after eating this salad.Don't get me wrong, the café is a nice place in general, just the quality of the food didn't meet my expectation - if served for that price! my sister had a regular latte and a veggie sandwich, which was quite nice (i had a bite or two) - but after adding 12,5% extra on the bill, we ended up paying 27 pounds for the whole lunch, which is way too pricey, even for London, for such little food and enjoyment.Most likely won't come back - maybe for breakfast but lunch really isn't worth the fuss at this place.

9rF1U2pn9lsvTfGvbThyUQ.text: Just walked 30 minutes over to this place...restaurant completely empty, we had a party of 6 and they made us sit in a terrible location that we didn't want to.  Food is terrible and service even worse.  Definitely not worth going to.  Recommend no one expecting good customer service to go there.  Staff was not welcoming at all.

_RH7vSQ7MC0PF564to91zQ.text: Hell yeah, first 5 stars review in a while but this place seems to become a favorite of ours (wife loves it too). It is in a nice area, place is a little away from the crowd, in a cosy, very nicely decorated location. Staff is mix nationality (but mostly french, hence the 5 stars?!?), menu is mainly healthy looking with plenty of gluten free, organic options, and is perfect for brunch. WHile the wait cant pull you off, it is worth waiting to get in. We have tried the sandwiches, the soup (lentil/red pepper), avocado toast, juices, liquid gold teas, lavander latte, and all were very good. Very friendly staff, smiley and all, you feel right at home. It does get very busy, so hang on a little for full attention, but overall quality-service combo pleases us all the time. Note : take the half sandwich, it is more than enough. and Try the cakes because they look good though we haven't tried any yet. We ll be back very soon.

hlo9_DZNTBjXw5Q_SzDHJw.text: The decor and location is great. The food is okay. The criticism of the food being that, in addition to being free of gluten and sugars, it is also pretty flavour free. The service is abysmal. Not merely slow, but also very dysfunctional. Every single table had to ask numerous times to be served, where there coffees were, where there food was and to get the bill.

EB9XXgFBdw2c09NHqmY5Lw.text: Best coffee in the neighborhood.Loft style, airy cafe, with nice garden seating.Sandwiches were also yummy. Deserts-average.

jDkl8MweU4ConlNcc8Vsfw.text: Super cute atmosphere. Stopped in after seeing this place on Pinterest. Didn't try any of their food, but my friend and I got drinks to go. I got a chai because well I love chai and heard that they put cinnamon on top in the design of a bulldog. Unfortunately the guy who made my drink didn't do this, and when I asked him to it didn't turn out so great. But awesome idea - maybe he was just new. All the other drinks and food I saw that people ordered looked delicious and well presented.

xrgXEKNTYUkW5oLObk2ATg.text: Location is lovely and the waiters are super friendly. Breakfast is focused on sustainable products and on the healthy side. Quality of coffee is improvable, but the rest is delicious. Very hip location...

l9VtRBwkQD13ei93Ol3BeQ.text: Worth the wait to get a table. Delicious gluten free pancakes. The menu is marked where items are dairy free or gluten free. Tasty fresh food!

BZhVzAGO53xj08svVhN5Zw.text: This place is awesome. The food was amazing, customer service was better than it needed to be. The atmosphere was chill and fun(just don't go on weekdays when school is getting out :/). Their food is always yummy. A favorite place in all of London for sure.

OK-CA0VV_7wtclFxcrWc-A.text: Really good food and coffee, love sitting outside in the garden.

QeDL3FqArxbcPgvM1xul3g.text: Coffee is pretty good. Free WiFi. Have to say service is very poor. Tables were free on a quiet weekday morning (only 3 occupied - total of 4people), 5 members of staff apparently nothing-doing and I waited 20min. before one of the waiters reminded himself that I ordered a slice of cake. Low point.

4Zfm0jNbz024ltm9dRYgRw.text: Was so glad they were open today on Easter Sunday as I only had today in London and wanted to try this place. Went at 1 pm and had no problem getting a seat at the communal table. I only dealt with two servers, but I thought the service was awesome! I ordered the crab cakes on the recommendation of the server and she was spot on... delicious! I got a side order of mushrooms on the recommendation of a different server and they were a very tiny portion and pretty mediocre. I would have given the place 5 stars but I am taking off 1 because they  are really pricey and not quite worth it. I'm taking off another star because I came back later in the afternoon to try the green smoothie and it was extremely expensive ($10), which would have been fine except that it was the most bland flavored smoothie I had ever had. Literally, it had no taste...or a very slight bad taste. I went and looked at the menu again to see what was in it and in hindsight, it's not that surprising... coconut milk, cucumber, olive oil, avocado... these foods have very little taste I guess, but there was supposedly kale that I couldn't taste. Still, it killed me, but I threw that $10 smoothie in the trash the moment I stepped outside.

enDO2zTFuXgI0RZfW00Tvw.text: This is the cutest place for a cosy catch up with your girlfriends and truly excellent drinks! Love the charming feel of the place and the lattes are both delicious and just asking to be Instagrammed. I tried the charcoal latte, which is black (very cool!) and sweetened with date syrup. It was surprisingly delicious, as was my husband's chai latte which came with the cutest dog latte art. I went in the late afternoon on a weekend and there weren't any pastries left plus the kitchen was closed as they don't stay open till evening, so I would say get there early if you want to eat or have brunch. The atmosphere was quite relaxed, with everyone chatting away at their cosy tables with no urgency. I think I would rather bring my girlfriends here than my husband, as the menu seems to be quite light other than the pastries. The staff here was really sweet and as this is Notting Hill, the crowd seemed posh. I am definitely coming back to try the rose latte and the avocado toast!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Such a cute place
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom

jbGeH4SCJ6LdKi6OFoTIAQ.text: I came for an early morning brunch with a friend while on my vacation to London after a recommendation by a friend and I'm so glad that I did! I love the healthy cafe trend in general to begin with. I got the Liquid Gold Latte to start which was hands down the best tumeric latte I've ever had. It was also super adorable with the frenchie pup latte art on top. I also got the avocado toast with a poached egg which had loads of avocado on it and a delicious lemon-y flavor. The atmosphere was very cute and if I lived in London I would definitely go back and try more of their lattes and brunch items.

CV1My4bu2asTF13Ld4tE0g.text: Cafe in Notting Hill. We set outside, it was really cozy. Staff was really friendly to us. We ordered cappuccino and toast with almond butter and strawberry jelly. One of the best coffee in London. I must praise their almond butter. it was really almond butter not some mix or anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom

iDOKwkbh4UWVhQS0OFYQXA.text: After a week of eating unhealthy food, I needed something clean. I came here specifically to try their charcoal latte while my friends got the rose latte and the blue latte. We also ordered eggs for breakfast. The space is adorable and you get cucumber water at your table. I loved the charcoal latte. My friends also liked their drinks but I think the rose latte was pretty plain. The eggs were basic and I thought it was pricey for what it was.

9nID-Kl4qdp0s3ppXyWihA.text: Yummy lattes: when the heat of the coffee melts the chocolate on the inside of the wafer and mixes with the light it's the best combination ever. Not the greatest açai bowl. Definitely not worth the price and I didn't like how it was runny (not thick as expected). Great chicken sandwich with a beautiful mixture of flavor. Wasn't expecting the full size to be so big, so I recommend getting it halved if you're not too hungry. Great service and atmosphere overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. The tastiest lattes ever

PiRtPSsAUYSMSQ8aGsZ8Mw.text: This is a charming little cafe tucked in between buildings just off Portobello Road in Notting Hill. Food and service were excellent and the music playing was fun! My son loved his avocado toast and we loved our breakfast: cheese omelette and apple pancakes. Cappuccinos were excellent both in terms of flavor and temperature. My kids didn't love their hot chocolate,...I think it was too natural/unprocessed for their palettes! :-)

lzhwfMirQ9Cn1bYQYvS8bA.text: Delicious and so many gluten free options!It was a Saturday at 10:40am and there was a 35-40 minute wait which we waited 35 minutes.Food was excellent - the pancakes were so fluffy and also ordered the Turkish eggs with gluten free bread (the gf bread was an extra £3.50)The outdoor patio is cute - we had a shared table. There was one waiter that was acting as waiter and host. The restaurant might benefit to hire a host/hostess on the weekends during busy time to maximize turnover of tables/arrangements.

3yYP1R6k23sPX6CohM_5IA.text: I honestly am a little torn when it comes to reviewing this place, I wanted to rave about how great it was until I actually visited and then...it wasn't! Sad times.I went there specifically to try the Rose latte having seen it recommended on a coffee blog. We arrived about 4.15 in the afternoon and were told there was no food being served anymore, with the exception of stuff on the counter. There were 2 croissants. That's it. The ones that'd presumably been sat out, uncovered, all day and hadn't yet sold. There wasn't a cake in sight! Disappointing, to say the least. The latte itself however was utterly delicious. It held such an unusual floral flavour, the milk having been infused with rose water and the latte topped with crushed rose petals. I seriously enjoyed it. It was just perfect and made such a refreshing change from sweet & sickly caramel coffees.  Whilst we were there we decided to peruse the menu in case we wanted to return but were entirely put off by the prices, £6-7.50 for a smoothie! The staff weren't particularly welcoming either, they certainly didn't do anything to persuade us the food or atmosphere were worth the money!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Rose latte. Made with rose water infused milk & topped with dried rose petals. Absolutely delicious. Such a delicate flavour.

th2SiZt01NXtpBEw7cqvfQ.text: note: go on a sunny day to avoid that line in the outdoors. but the wait was definitely worth it. would recommend the yogurt and fruit as it is defffff above average in taste and presentation. also the rose latte for any latte lovers, as it's easily one of the most unique latte's i've ever had (and i usually really dislike flavored coffee). very conveniently located - so once you've put you name down on the waitlist, have a quick walk through notting hill (but keep an eye on time so you don't miss your name being called!)an overall lovely brekkie

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. avo toast, acai bowl, yogurt and fruit bowl, and a rose latte

nlaNVTylU5cR9yXzVgnBwQ.text: Nice tucked in place in the middle of a busy market Had one of the best pumpkin porridges The avocado and toast and poached egged were very nice match latte with coconut milk was amazing Will definitely go there again

8x8NCI4JVgITTYBHsF6JQw.text: I really liked this place. It was busy but they sat us pretty quickly. I came here because I saw it on a lot of food Instagrams. I got the chai latte, which had super cute latte art. My pancakes were sooo good and my boyfriend liked his crab cakes. It's really trendy, and the type of place you would see in LA (organic, etc).

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Chai Latte - 3.70
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. GF Berry Pancakes - 11  (Benoits buckwheat mix with amber maple syrup, peppermint & fresh strawberries sprinkled with coconut shavings)

vsEJ1kzwPc9NedttxNgv4w.text: Went to there for an afternoon catchup over coffee. Both the charcoal and rose latte were nice. Love the place!

Opp3vfjDsxcUBqN5MmAxFQ.text: I absolutely LOVED Farm Girl cafe! When I go on trips I like to look up cool places on Instagram because you can find cool gems like this. I ordered the Latte Black, Rose Latte and Coconut BLT. The Latte Black (w activated charcoal) was cool and different, sort of tasted like warm milk though. I really enjoyed the Rose Latte and appreciated its uniqueness and the infused rose water was quite amazing. The Coconut BLT was also good, it didn't really stick out to me, but wasn't bad. I went midday on a Monday and there was only a 15 minute wait. However, I heard the weekend wait is a lot longer so I'd recommend visiting on a weekday. Furthermore the staff was super friendly and the environment was quirky and cute. I'd definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Latte Black (double shot blended with activated charcoal+date syrup) and the Coconut BLT (w/ coconut bacon)

-ZK4H2ujpJJmeb2vr4503w.text: Refreshing lunch was just what we needed in the middle of stay filled with hearty meals in London.

zW2AjIwBRczj2UReisttOg.text: Awesome little cafe on Portobello road. It has a limited seating, some inside and some outside, and we had about a 30 min wait to get a table on a Sunday afternoon. It was so cute through and the food was worth it! We got avocado toast to share for the table, and they give you cucumber water too which was refreshing. We got a rose and matcha latte, which are just so darn cute. For my meal, I ordered the berry pancakes which really lived up to my expectations. They were fluffy but still healthier than an average pancake because they're made out of buckwheat, and the berries, coconut, and syrup on top made it so tasty! My friends ordered the pitaya bowl and the farm salad, which were excellent as well. For take away, I got one of the vegan donuts for the next morning and it was soooo yummy! Definitely take a look at the baked goods at the counter.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes!! Must try
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Rose and matcha lattes

IfkfMtA9OA7IDP873nTKmw.text: The coffee was great. I ordered a rose latte (loved it!) and my cousin ordered a chai latte. The coffee was good and came in a good amount of time, a little price-y but worth it for the uniqueness of it. The staff seemed a little stressed and seemed to want to get people in and out quickly, since the line to get in can long. I was in a rush and did not get a chance to order food this time around, but would probably come back for the coffee (probably as take away, however, since getting a table can take a bit of time).

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Chai Latte
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Rose Latte

mvLWoe9T_kR3DBp33pKf8w.text: The avotoast is to die for!! All the menu looks incredible and with lots of options The place is really niceThe service is great

-ll8geXnubCfeNDrT0lRdA.text: Excellent Brunch!Food was great, service was perfect and we loved the design of the place! We were on the communal table on the mezzanine and had a great overview of the space. Will come back!It was worth waiting for 45minutes to get a seat!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Blueberry pancakes

QOpPiqQnNgmQFF1bY8t40A.text: The atmosphere and decor of Farm Girl is trendy, with lots of cool art and plants. However, the food itself is not very great. I ordered the chicken wrap which honestly tasted like cardboard. It had little to no dressing, a tiny bit of chicken, and soggy lettuce. It also said it came with a side salad, but did not. I had to ask the waiter, and he said the menu was wrong. My friend got the avocado toast and enjoyed it though. Definitely not worth the price.

dB9M5cWckTdFxiprbExyKw.text: This place is very cute and has great health food / trendy food options. I have to echo what many have said regarding the fact that the food could taste a bit better, but to be honest, I'd come back :)

vjjH6q51ssMrQT2I7eOSlQ.text: This little cafe is really picture-esque and cute. It's on Portobello Road in Notting Hill, but it's inside this little courtyard with a lot of plants away from the crowd. The cafe inside is very aesthetic with sketches on the walls and this blue tiling. The menu is entirely vegetarian, and there is a lot of nice options for vegan dishes, gluten free, and dairy free. I tried the pink salad which had watermelon, cucumber, kale with a little bit of nori sprinkled on top. It came this honey mustard and berry vinaigrette. The watermelon was very refreshing, but I found that the salad was a little bland; I wish it came with more dressing. For cafe, I ordered the rose latte. It was so-so, but very instagramable. The VIP of the brunch was definitely the coconut BLT sandwich. They had vegan bacon made from smoked coconut! The sandwich came with tomatoes, lettuce, and a generous amount of fresh guacamole. It came with toasty bread, and it was one of my favorites! Overall, the aesthetic of this cafe is everything: very cute and features a nice selection of farm to plate menu options.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Rose Latte
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Coconut BLT Sandwich
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Cafe counter

jcotkGqds8bX8FqKfPCUhw.text: I went here for the first time about a month ago.LOCATION: This location is in Notting Hill on Portobello Road. It's a nice and cute area, and I like how the cafe is kind of tucked away (it's not hard to find or anything though, but if you've been there/once you see it, you'd get what I mean by "tucked away" lol. 4/5ATMOSPHERE: There's a little outdoor patio area, as well as inside seating. It's pretty quaint and homey. 4/5SELECTION: They're whole menu is basically brunch-type items, like breakfast foods, sandwiches and salads, and lots of different drinks, like lots of unique lattes, coffees, and juices. I like that they label which items are vegan, gluten-free, and nut-free. They could have a few more vegan items, but then again, I shouldn't complain because at least they have a few and they're clearly-labeled. 3/5WHAT I GOT: I got their Latte Black and Acai Bowl with granola (£3 extra). First off, the latte was amazing. Hands down, it was the best latte of my life. It's a charcoal latte, so the ingredients are activated charcoal, date syrup, and cashew milk. Thinking back, the taste of it was simple and basic, but it was unique and it wasn't bitter or anything, nor overly sweet. I'm sorry, I really don't know how to describe it, but if you're into health-conscious wellness-type lattes at all, I'd definitely recommend it. On to their Acai Bowl: it was pretty good. It wasn't one of the best I've ever had, but it was still tasty. The acai blend was thick, but it could've been a little less icy-ish (not that there were icy chunks, but I've just found that when acai bowls are made with almond milk -- like this one -- they have this weird icy-ish texture, so maybe a thicker milk like cashew milk would be better...just my take). Anyways on to the toppings: the fruit was good, including the coconut, as well as the chia seeds. And the granola was pretty good as well -- it wasn't too chewy or hard. I just don't get why they charge extra for it, when most acai bowls automatically come with granola. 4/5SERVICE: The service was good. All the employees were nice and attentive, and we didn't have to wait an abnormal amount of time for our food to come out. 4/5

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Latte Black (4): activated charcoal, date syrup, and cashew milk
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Acai Bowl (8) w/granola (3 extra): frozen Amazonian berries, banana, and almond milk; topped w/summer fruits, chia seeds, and granola

ic18cUst7GcfRhcjb0fccQ.text: It was a very cute restaurant and the food was very healthy. The chicken sandwich had too much lettuce and the hibiscus matcha was not tasteful at all. The waitress also was short on my change by £5 but the owners of the store were very nice and gave me the correct change.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom

-9thCePESkLmGQHTLOqcKA.text: Popular place on the weekends due to Insta-fame: we lined for maybe 20 min for a table. Very organic, trendy, farm-to-table and charcoal, tumeric, rose latte kind of place. I always appreciate a range of healthy options on the menu, even as it usually comes with a price hike. I got the coconut pancakes and they were good! The dessicated coconut was maybe more of a feature rather than a garnish than it should've been, but I much enjoyed the syrupy pear on top, and also the fact that the table salt was pink Himalayan, though I never used it of course. Overall, solid place to go for the trendiness, though beware a wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom

sdLwUQoYEuMgGYZwxdyIZw.text: With disappointing service and gross bathrooms, this place's only saving grace is its matcha lattes, which are heavenly. I don't know what type of magic they add in the lattes, but they are so delicious and give you a refreshing kick. The lattes are also velvety and smooth, rich but not overdone. However, this place has gross - really gross - bathrooms, and the server was rude to everyone waiting for a table.Would come here to take away a match latte, but not for anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Matcha latte (energizing and sweet)

_NavQr2-fyJ4FznILIx_PA.text: Expect to wait in a line on the weekends, my girlfriend and I waited for about 20 minutes for brunch. I got roasted beet salad with goat cheeand the scrambled eggs on top of sourdough bread. My girlfriend got the berry pancakes with a side of scrambled egg. We were both satisfied, although I did not realize the roasted beet salad was actually just roasted beets and no lettuce. Pancakes were out of this world. Service was 5/10 and the restaurant was so busy! Lively atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom

z3JGRn3Mg5vPHn8_ArX0_Q.text: Came here on a Sunday afternoon for a really late lunch. There wasn't a wait but the place was still full.  Ordered an avocado toast with a side of goat cheese. They did not skimp on the avocado, which was awesome, but I found the bread a bit too chewy for my liking (not in a good way). It was impossible to cut with a knife and I ended up just picking it up to eat it. Besides that, the food was good and the oat milk latte was strong and delicious.  Service was ok. It came out to be quite expensive for the amount of food but that might just be London prices. I wouldn't really revisit again- primarily due to the disappointment of the bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Outdoor seating
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Avocado toast with a side of goat cheese
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Avocado toast and oat milk latte

LjwredxwUy7AKmA3wZSHDQ.text: Beautiful place, atmosphere and food, and while it doesn't lack in presentation, it lacked in flavor a bit. I saw this place all over the internet and as a lover of cafe culture I knew I had to go here after a visit to Notting Hill. My sister ordered the fruit & yogurt which she enjoyed, and I ordered the avocado toast with a poached egg. It was presented beautifully but the avocado was seasoned poorly and the egg was also very bland. It tasted fresh but was lacking seasoning for sure, I've had much better. We also had two croissants, pistachio and raspberry - they were very good, raspberry was definitely the better of the two. For drinks, I ordered the chai latte which was wonderful, and my sister had a pretty average cappuccino. Service was prompt, kind, and accommodating - bathrooms needed some attention - but overall it's an inviting and warm, atmospheric place to have breakfast/brunch/lunch. The ladies sitting next to my sister & I ordered more savory items on their varied menu and the smell was wonderful - so perhaps just ask for some salt/pepper if you choose to order the avo toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom

Ew7uGocmEBaVd91c2hFCmw.text: I had the most amazing hot chocolate. The staff was very friendly and nice. Very hipster but that was to be expected. I had toast with jam. It wasn't my favorite, because the bread was soooo hard. Most people ordered the toast with avocado so I think I might have ordered the wrong thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Apple pancakes?
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate

X6vAA_PpuW7qoUFB3MHH3Q.text: The first time I'd heard of this place was when a group of friends and I decided on a whim to stop by for lunch on a Saturday at half past noon; unsurprisingly the queue was massive, with a 2-hour wait, so we gave it a miss. However, that did make me want to try again later, so the next time I needed to make breakfast plans with a friend, I suggested we come here shortly before 10 AM, again on a Saturday.When we arrived, all of the outdoor seating and a large chunk of the indoor seating was already occupied. However, we did get a table without having to wait. It was a bit of a tight squeeze, as all the tables are really close together. It does make it easy to spy on what the other customers ordered, which can help you make a decision since a lot of the items on the menu look enticing. The restaurant is cute and charming and has a cozy atmosphere.We went for the acai bowl and the baked eggs as our mains, along with the rose latte and the hibiscus matcha latte. We also spied an interesting-looking green-striped croissant that the waiter informed us was pistachio flavored; we ordered this too and it was served on a warm plate. There was complimentary cucumber water at each table.I loved everything we ordered. The acai bowl was very refreshing and the eggs were flavorful and reminiscent of Mediterranean cuisine. I did wish the eggs had come with more than 1 slice of bread; even if my friend and I hadn't been sharing everything we ordered, I still would have wanted more bread for just myself. The rose latte was beautifully decorated and really did taste of rose. The hibiscus latte was really tasty too. The pistachio croissant had a green pistachio gel inside and I think it was also on the outside as a decorative stripe; I would have liked to have had actual pistachio somewhere in or on the croissant, but I imagine that changes the baking.I didn't think we were rushed at all during our meal, but we did come before the brunch rush. By the time we left, at around 11-11:30, there was a pretty long queue, but not as long as the one I'd seen the first time I came here. The service wasn't terribly fast, but I didn't think it was particularly slow either, and certainly not slower than what I've experienced elsewhere in London. The staff we encountered were friendly and willing to answer questions.Our total meal came out to be about £35, which isn't bad for London and seemed reasonable given the amount of food we ordered. I was able to pay with my American bank card without any issues (signature required). The restaurant is very well located; definitely stop by the Notting Hill Portobello Road Market if you're there on a Saturday!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Acai bowl, baked eggs, pistachio croissant, hibiscus matcha latte, and rose latte
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Rose latte
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Pistachio croissant

QG3zK6LMX45pOMAGwcRj1g.text: Read the reviews before coming here and knew there was probably going to be a line, which there was. We waited about 30 minutes to get a spot, but once we finally got a spot the food and service was quick and great. Ordered a latte and the avocado toast and would recommend. Was surprised with how much food was served. Very yummy! The atmosphere here is great and would recommend this place to someone who is tired of pub food. But be cautious and come when you have some time to spare because you probably will be waiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom

gQaythv1qjuciB9tm1SY2A.text: Expected more from this cute, hipster place in Notting Hill. My boyfriend and I decided to try Farm Girl during our last trip after recommended to us by a local blogger.I admire their menu for being health conscious with many gluten and dairy free options, but we were not impressed with the food. I ordered an English Breakfast tea and a scramble on toast. My scramble didn't have much flavor at all and only had a few ingredients in it - basically just plain eggs on toast.Other than the cute interior, I felt rushed to eat my food and leave so they could flip my table. Wish I liked the food better because it's such a cute place, but had way better meals throughout our trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Such a cute interior design
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Enjoying a hot tea

3Mj4qlqwfAeOG6z0FtELuw.text: We LOVED this place!  So chic, super trendy, and also actually delicious!  Wish I could go every weekend for brunch.We only had to wait maybe 5-10 minutes to snag a great table inside.  Even though it was a beautiful day out I was happy to be inside because the decor is amazing.  Creates a really hip atmosphere, but not necessarily hipster or over the top.The drink menu is really interesting, love all the different colorful latte options.  I had the blue matcha and it was really good and very insta-worthy.  The avocado toast was divine.  The bread was perfectly thick and was an amazing carrier of the fresh, citrusy avocado.  We also tried the pancakes which were really good.  Sooooo fluffy we couldn't believe it, and the syrup was delish.Basically I'm considering moving to London just to become a regular at Farm Girl.

MZf8z0nqfbGIegjQ8nrE2g.text: The food was definitely good, and fresh. It was uncomfortably hot in the restaurant and our waiter was slow to bring us our drinks and cups for the (very warm) water on the table. It's certainly an "Instagram-worthy" restaurant, but not sure I would come back again.

HlbLRFOneGWpXAGZdJ9TbQ.text: This place is a dream. Incredible lattes, great ambience, and one of the best avocado toasts you'll find north of the Thames. I take all of my visiting friends here and it never disappoints.Bonus points for the Liquid Gold Latte and Charcoal Latte...exquisite! The vegan BLT is a winner.*Disclaimer* if you are not willing/prepared to wait 30+ minutes for a table then this isn't the place for you. Although it is TOTALLY worth the wait, please plan accordingly or your dreams will be crushed.

erza4OGVR5VOuFQ4EMdc4Q.text: One of our favorite places! Even on a busy Saturday they were able to get us in quickly and serve us a delicious brunch! Can't wait to go back when we are in town!

sXbiDL_fnS3w8v0qzh1ooA.text: THIS PLACE IS A MUST if you find yourself near Portobello Road or in Notting Hill - OR in London for that matter. The drinks and food are visually beautiful and just as delicious. Very unique yet simplistic flavors. The atmosphere is chic and casual. The avocado toast was filling and the amount of avocado on it was beyond worthy of the price. NOTEWORTHY: I've never had a more perfectly cooked poached egg.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom

VIIPX_7cHpinr8NSe99pRg.text: Overall really disappointing. First, we were met by a member of staff who didn't greet us, he just looked at me and my friend as we walked in and as time went on he kept up this unfriendly manner. Secondly, everything is SUPER expensive and the servings are tiny, total waste of money! My friend and I ordered an açai bowl each that although tasted nice, was nothing extraordinary, and was served in the most tiny bowl. I also ordered a hibiscus latte which was nice however again super expensive and nothing extraordinary. The whole dining experience just felt stiff and unwelcoming, not to mention the absurdly high compulsory service fee they lump on at the end, on top of the exorbitant cost of the food. Although the decor is pretty, don't get sucked in. I'm sure there are many other cute cafes which offer friendlier service and better value for you to spend your money on. Don't go here!

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom

kL-VAzIzw1SlMhoRBOHk3Q.text: This little cafe in Portobello Road is pretty small but it does have a seating area upstairs for a large group of about 8 people.  When we arrived there was a very long queue snaking out into the street.  Luckily I had a reserved table so was seated after about 5 minutes.  It's not recommended to just turn up ad hoc at the busiest times, we arrived at midday and there was a long queue throughout the entire time we were there, so book ahead or get there early.  On paper the menu sounds like a vegan and clean eating person's dream.  There are superfood ingredients, meat-free options like coconut bacon, gluten and wheat-free options everywhere.  But in reality they don't taste as good as they sound.  There's also a wide variety of drinks including Kumbacha, Kifir water, latte's, juices and teas.  I ordered the Liquid Gold Latte (no coffee),  which was actually amazing and was the best thing I had there.  We also ordered the steak and chips which is an onglet steak with a few thick sweet potato chips, cashew cream and vegetable mayonnaise.  Unfortunately both our steaks were as tough as old boots and had no flavour including the cream/mayonnaise.  I probably only ate a third of the dish because it tasted awful.  I asked staff if they had an alternative sauce to make the meal taste better, they only had guacamole which also tasted of nothing.  I heard various other diners saying that the food didn't taste good and was pricey with small portions.  I concur, my dish cost £16.50 it definitely wasn't worth it and tasted bad.  I would have loved to have come back again just for the Gold Latte but there's no way I'm waiting in a long queue for that length off time.

photos.caption: Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Steak and chips
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Liquid Gold Latte- Tumeric, Cinnamon, Astralagus, Honey, Almond Milk. Really nice!
Photo of Farm Girl Cafe - London, United Kingdom

er0rTcyZs5MTBrSDoABcwg.text: Cute fresh healthy and had a couple of unique options. Small courtyard and tiny indoor seating but worth the short wait we had. Avocado toast was great with probably 2 avocados piled high on crunchy sourdough. My daughter had the chicken sandwich and it was delish. Beautiful lattes. Glad we found it.
